name: 700th Anniversary of the Mayoralty of the City of London
obverse: Busts of Richard I and Queen Victoria are enclosed in two circular areas. Below is Saint George (the patron saint of England) slaying the dragon.
obverse_inscriptions: · TO COMMEMORATE THE 700TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE MAYORALTY OF THE CITY OF LONDON ·
reverse: Saint Michael presents a scepter to a woman representing London. In background are Westminster Abbey, Cleopatra's Needle, and St. Paul's Cathedral. Above is a radiating crown. To the left are the Mansion House and Temple Bar. To the right is the old London Bridge with a ship docked..
reverse_inscriptions: THE POWERS THAT BE ARE ORDAINED OF GOD
description: This medal is part of the City of London series.
